p: New polyketide-terpene hybrid metabolites 1 and 5 were tested for their inhibition activity following the NCCLS recommendations against six phytopathogenic fungi Botrytis cinerea (ACCC 37347), Verticillium dahliae (ACCC 36916), Fusarium oxysporum (ACCC 37438), Alternaria solani (ACCC 36023), Fusarium gramineum (ACCC 36249), and Rhizoctonia solani (ACCC36124) obtained from Agricultural Culture Collection of China (ACCC). The antifungal assay displayed that 1 and 5 exhibited pronounced biological effects against F. oxysporum with MIC (minimum inhibitory concentration) value of 8 g/mL, whereas 5 can potently inhibited F. gramineum at concentration of 8 g/mL, compared with the positive control ketoconazole (MIC value of 8 g/mL) [ 9].
